issue.title: Include a license (MIT, in this case)
issue.body:
Hey guys. I'd like to include a license in this project, and I wanted to make sure everyone was okay with that.

I was thinking MIT (http://choosealicense.com/licenses/mit/) because it allows easy distribution with attribution back to us.

Thoughts or alternate proposals?

issue.title: User Name Subdomains
issue.body:
I would like to add support for user name subdomains to access a profile.
For example:
`corban.bucketeer.me` would redirect to my profile.

It seems that the best way to do this would be to add a URL rule to Django to support `/profile/{USERNAME}`, and add an Nginx rewrite rule to push `{USERNAME}.bucketeer.me` to `bucketeer.me/{USERNAME}`. 

On the Nginx-side, I already know the rules necessary. See [here](http://stackoverflow.com/a/21230992).

Thoughts? Do people like this idea? I kind of wanted to move away from the `/profile/{NUMBER}` style anyways.

issue.title: Add a License
issue.body: We could use one. Go open source! I'm always a fan of the GPL, although you can see more [here](http://choosealicense.com/)

issue.title: Tags are messed up when editing an item
issue.body:
If you edit a tagged item, the tags field will display as "<item name> tagged with <tag name>". If you then save the item, the item becomes tagged with every word in the sentence above.

It should populate the 'tags' field with a space-separated list of tags.

issue.title: Tags are messed up when editing an item
issue.body:
If you edit a tagged item, the tags field will display as "<item name> tagged with <tag name>". If you then save the item, the item becomes tagged with every word in the sentence above.

It should populate the 'tags' field with a space-separated list of tags.

issue.title: Tags are messed up when editing an item
issue.body:
If you edit a tagged item, the tags field will display as "<item name> tagged with <tag name>". If you then save the item, the item becomes tagged with every word in the sentence above.

It should populate the 'tags' field with a space-separated list of tags.

issue.title: Forward to profile page after editing profile
issue.body: Currently, after editing a profile, it redirects back to the edit profile screen.

issue.title: Password change functionality
Switching from keeping "Age" to keeping "Birthday"?
issue.body:
It was pointed out to me that we ask for and display the user's age, but that will change yearly. 

Would people prefer to have the site ask for and keep the user's birthday, and then we can do the math?

issue.title: Switching from keeping "Age" to keeping "Birthday"?
issue.body:
It was pointed out to me that we ask for and display the user's age, but that will change yearly. 

Would people prefer to have the site ask for and keep the user's birthday, and then we can do the math?

issue.title: Fix the complete checkbox when editing items
issue.body: Currently, toggling the box when editing an item does nothing, and the checkbox doesn't indicate the initial state.

issue.title: Ability to delete items from the edit item page.
User Name Subdomains

I would like to add support for user name subdomains to access a profile.

issue.title: Allow lookup of a user profile by username.
issue.body:
Changes the following functionality:
- `/profile/<ID>` has been moved to `/profile/id/<ID>`
- `/profile/<USERNAME>` is now the standard way to view a profile
- `/profile/` now redirects to `/profile/<YOUR_USERNAME>`, instead of just hiding the username
- usernames for new user registrations are now limited to the characters: `[a-zA-Z0-9.-]`

issue.title: Django Admin Site static files fail to load
issue.body: I noticed the admin CSS files aren't loading correctly. You should try [this](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4420378/why-my-django-admin-site-does-not-have-the-css-style).
